meanings.sent1: She always premeasures the ingredients before baking a cake.
meanings.sent2: The tailor premeasured the fabric before cutting it for the dress.
meanings.sent3: Before the cooking competition, the chef premeasured all the spices but accidentally mixed up the labels.
meanings.sent4: His meticulous premeasuring of the room's dimensions ensured the furniture fit perfectly.
meanings.sent5: The architect premeasured the space to ensure the new building would fit seamlessly into the neighborhood.

meanings.definition: To determine the size, amount, or degree of something before it is needed.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter premeasured the wood to avoid any wastage.
meanings.sent2: Before the trip, she premeasured the amount of food needed for each day.
meanings.sent3: The student premeasured the time it took to solve each math problem to improve efficiency.
meanings.sent4: By premeasuring the distance, the hiker knew exactly how far he had to go.
meanings.sent5: The scientist premeasured the chemicals for the experiment to ensure accurate results.
